pulltitle: Add Mozilla Code of Conduct
pullsbody:
Fixes #20


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_repo_desc: Script to reconcile a dump of the FxA user database with Basket
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #20.

_(Message COC002)_

pulltitle: refactor: Convert to streams to handle pressure/backoff
pullsbody:
@jrgm - this builds on #8 and converts everything to Node streams so that we can send to SNS w/o needing 16GB of RAM. Instead of fire and forget, this will send each message in sequence. Hopefully this is more robust for when we send the verified events.

f?
pull_repo_desc: Script to reconcile a dump of the FxA user database with Basket
pull_commit_message: refactor: Convert to streams to handle pressure/backoff

pulltitle: fix(parsing): Date input/output normalization.
pullsbody:
* CSV dates are expected to be milliseconds since Unix epoch.
* JSON dates are ISO8601
* SQS receives seconds since Unix epoch.

* Internally dates are Date objects.
pull_repo_desc: Script to reconcile a dump of the FxA user database with Basket
pull_commit_message:
fix(parsing): Date input/output normalization.

* CSV dates are expected to be milliseconds since Unix epoch.
* JSON dates are ISO8601
* SQS receives seconds since Unix epoch.

* Internally dates are Date objects.

pulltitle: fix(parsing): use csv-parse to handle optionally double-quoted columns
pullsbody:
So, in pulling the locale from accounts into the csv, I remembered that the value there is actually the `accept-language` value, which can in practice contain whitespace. So this PR adds the use of a real csv parser, which can accept optionally double-quoted columns. It is also configured to trim leading/trailing WS on unquoted columns, but will not trim quoted columns. But this accept-language value should be further processed by the rules we use in fxa to determine best language.

r? - @shane-tomlinson
pull_repo_desc: Script to reconcile a dump of the FxA user database with Basket
pull_commit_message: fix(parsing): use csv-parse to handle optionally double-quoted columns
